de.fu.weave.orm
Class ConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
  de.fu.weave.orm.ConnectionManager

public class ConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object

Handles database connectivity.

The sole purpose of this Manager is to maintain a Connection to the database. When a Servlet is initiated, it will call connect() to establish a permanent link to the database. However, it will not throw an error if the connection could not be established due to timeout or something like that. If a connection is needed Modules should use validate() which will test if the connection is alive and attempt to reconnect in case it is not.

In case validate() returns false the last Exception will be stored instead of thrown. It might be retrieved using getLastException()

Author:
Julian Fleischer

Field Detail

connection

java.sql.Connection connection
The connection-object to the database.

This will be null if no connecting is established at the moment, be it due to connect() having failed or validate() having spot an already established link being broken.

It is package private (default) since it oughts to be read by EntityManager (for instance) which is in the same package.

Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
             throws ConnectionManagerException
Attempts to establish a connection.

If the Driver is not available an Exception will be thrown. Two possibilities may lead to an Exception being thrown: (1) The database driver could not be loaded (is it in the path?), or (2) The driver is incorrectly configured (wrong username/password/...). If some other kind of Exception occurs it will not be thrown but catched and stored. It can be retrieved using getLastException().

Throws:
ConnectionManagerException - If the database-driver is not available

getLastException

public ConnectionManagerException getLastException()
Returns the last exception which has not been thrown by connect()

If the Manager connected to the database successfully this method will return null.

Returns:
The last Exception (in case of error)

validate

public boolean validate()
                 throws ConnectionManagerException
Checks if the connection is still alive.

This method is used by the Controller to check the Connection for Modules which require database-connectivity as denoted by ModuleInfo.requires().

Returns:
If the Connection is alive or not.
Throws:
ConnectionManagerException - If the connection is down and can not be re-established
